resources.string: Situated in the middle of the town with white sand and clear turquoise waters. It is a calm beach so it is safe for all of the family!
A 15km hike that takes you around different beaches and also has stunning views!
Looking to catch some waves? Lanzada is the beach to go. With surf classes for begginers too!
Ever felt like going to the Caribbean? This is the closest thing to it, with white beaches and clear waters you are sure to be satisfied.
A traditional Spanish Galician dish. This dish is prepared by first boiling the octopus inside a copper cauldron.
Being right by the sea, Sanxenxos restaurants offer a wide and fresh variety of seafood.
Is the first beef with integral control and guarantee certificate, which has obtained the maximum recognition and protection worldwide.
A variety of white wine grape grown in Galicia. The wine produced is unusually light, and generally high in acidity.
Camping for all the family. Whether it is in a Bungalow or a tent, you are sure to have fun! Situated between Montalvo and Paxariñas.
This 4 star hotel has everything: Spa, tennis courts, gym, childrens activities, outdoor swimming pool, you name it, they have it!
Want to feel more at home? There are plenty of apartments for rent just for the summer! That way you are travelling from home to home.
The Parador de Cambados is located in an old country house known as Bazán, an elegant ancestral mansion.
As Sanxenxo is in Galicia, Gallego, the official language, is spoken here. But everyone also speaks Castellano (spanish) too!
July and August is tourist season, meaning that it gets pretty crowed and to find a spot on the beac becomes more difficult.
In Sanxenxo you have sea and mountains!! Silgar is a nice beach but there a many other hidden treasures like Playa de Canelas which do no get as busy!
